decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells to bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard, such as Griselbrand and Ulamog, to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist to facilitate this strategy, while also running disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control the opponent's game plan. With the ability to quickly bring back threats and disrupt the opponent's plays, this deck aims to close out games before the opponent has a chance to recover.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board using powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells to disrupt your opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command, All Is Dust, and Through the Breach, you can clear the way for your Eldrazi titans like Ulamog and Emrakul to dominate the game. The deck also includes ramping cards like Talisman of Impulse and Ancient Stirrings to help you reach your big threats faster. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm your opponent with massive creatures and efficient control spells to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. Utilizing cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Amped Raptor, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and buffs to further push the pressure. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge adds additional reach and removal to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through relentless attacking and powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature-based strategies, utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Territorial Kavu, backed up by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and mana ramping potential. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding offer protection and disruption against opposing strategies. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to quickly deploy threats and apply pressure to opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana acceleration and allow for quick deployment of powerful land-based threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber in combination with bounce lands and utility lands, the deck can chain together powerful land drops and tutor for key pieces with cards like Summoner's Pact. The goal is to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan, fetching lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent, or in some cases, assemble a deadly combo with The One Ring.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and cantrips to cast a flurry of spells, ultimately leading to a lethal Grapeshot or Wish combo. It uses Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate additional mana and draw cards, along with other card selection spells like Reckless Impulse to dig deeper into the deck. The deck also includes Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and maintain momentum. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw while utilizing The One Ring as a win condition. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and establish control of the battlefield before overwhelming them with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Wrath of the Skies. The deck includes a mix of counter magic, removal, and card advantage to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent. It also includes some disruption tools like Subtlety and Dress Down to handle problematic cards or strategies from the opponent.

This deck focuses on a strategy of controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption and removal spells. It also aims to generate value through recurring creatures from the graveyard and gaining life to stabilize the game. Additionally, it includes a finisher in Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Soul Spike to close out the game. The mana base is structured to ensure consistent access to both black and green sources, along with utility lands for added flexibility in different situations.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and board state through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The key strategy revolves around using The One Ring as a win condition while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes various utility lands and versatile cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to help maintain control of the game. By managing resources effectively and using powerful spells at the right moments, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through strategic decision-making.

This deck aims to rapidly fill the graveyard with cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore in order to quickly deploy powerful threats like Hollow One and Nethergoyf. Utilizing cards like Bloodstained Mire and Mishra's Bauble for card selection and potential card advantage, the deck is looking to apply pressure and close out the game quickly with aggressive creatures like Detective's Phoenix and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The inclusion of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push helps to maintain control of the board while dealing damage to the opponent.
